trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Services is a highly scalable mobile application development platform that lets you add enhanced functionality to your mobile device apps by using Azure.
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Services is a highly scalable mobile application development platform that lets you add enhanced functionality to your mobile device apps by using Azure.

trans-unit.source: Build native and cross platform apps - Connect your iOS, Android, Windows, or cross-platform Xamarin or Cordova (Phonegap) apps to your backend mobile service using native SDKs.
trans-unit.target: Build native and cross platform apps - Connect your iOS, Android, Windows, or cross-platform Xamarin or Cordova (Phonegap) apps to your backend mobile service using native SDKs.

trans-unit.source: Send push notifications to your users - Send push notifications to your users of your app.
trans-unit.target: Send push notifications to your users - Send push notifications to your users of your app.

trans-unit.source: Authenticate your users - Leverage popular identity providers like Facebook and Twitter to authenticate your app users.
trans-unit.target: Authenticate your users - Leverage popular identity providers like Facebook and Twitter to authenticate your app users.

trans-unit.source: Store data in the cloud - Store user data in a SQL Database (by default) or in Mongo DB, DocumentDB, Azure Tables, or Azure Blobs.
trans-unit.target: Store data in the cloud - Store user data in a SQL Database (by default) or in Mongo DB, DocumentDB, Azure Tables, or Azure Blobs.

trans-unit.source: Build offline-ready apps with sync - Make your apps work offline and use Mobile Services to sync data in the background.
trans-unit.target: Build offline-ready apps with sync - Make your apps work offline and use Mobile Services to sync data in the background.

trans-unit.source: Monitor and scale your apps - Monitor app usage and scale your backend as demand grows.
trans-unit.target: Monitor and scale your apps - Monitor app usage and scale your backend as demand grows.

trans-unit.source: The following are important features and concepts in the Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: The following are important features and concepts in the Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source: Application key: a unique value that is used to limit access to your mobile service from random clients; this "key" is not a security token and is not used to authenticate users of your app.
trans-unit.target: Application key: a unique value that is used to limit access to your mobile service from random clients; this "key" is not a security token and is not used to authenticate users of your app.

trans-unit.source: Backend: the mobile service instance that supports your app.
trans-unit.target: Backend: the mobile service instance that supports your app.

trans-unit.source: A mobile service is implemented either as an ASP.NET Web API project (.NET backend ) or as a Node.js project (JavaScript backend).
trans-unit.target: A mobile service is implemented either as an ASP.NET Web API project (.NET backend ) or as a Node.js project (JavaScript backend).

trans-unit.source: Identity provider: an external service, trusted by Mobile Services, that authenticates your app's users.
trans-unit.target: Identity provider: an external service, trusted by Mobile Services, that authenticates your app's users.

trans-unit.source: Supported providers include: Facebook, Twitter, Google, Microsoft Account, and Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Supported providers include: Facebook, Twitter, Google, Microsoft Account, and Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Push notification: Service-initiated message that is sent to a registered device or user using Azure Notification Hubs.
trans-unit.target: Push notification: Service-initiated message that is sent to a registered device or user using Azure Notification Hubs.

trans-unit.source: Scale: The ability to add, for an additional cost, more processing power, performance, and storage as your app becomes more popular.
trans-unit.target: Scale: The ability to add, for an additional cost, more processing power, performance, and storage as your app becomes more popular.

trans-unit.source: Scheduled job: Custom code that is run either on a pre-determined schedule or on-demand.
trans-unit.target: Scheduled job: Custom code that is run either on a pre-determined schedule or on-demand.
